main event: Mr. J.K. Rittenhouse reported sighting a cigar-shaped object flying northwest of his home in Hopkins, Minnesota on January 10, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as 15 miles long and star-like in appearance., The object changed from brilliant to dull as it was observed., Mr. Rittenhouse used a powerful telescope and binoculars to observe the object., The object was noted to resemble no known type of plane., The observation concluded with the object disappearing beyond the horizon.
witness description: Mr. J.K. Rittenhouse, a resident of Hopkins.
